attributes.action: Shift subsidies and tax breaks from fossil fuels to renewable for a safer future
attributes.background: Gas and petroleum companies are economically supported through tax breaks and hidden subsidies, UK is reliant on external suppliers at detriment to our immediate and global environment. Shift support to UK based renewable energy production and storage to create a stable and safe supply.
attributes.additional_details:
Although the government claims to not support fossil fuel industry through subsidies it does so in ways that are hidden to consumers.

Britain currently supports the fossil fuel industry through tax breaks and subsidies for exploration and research and development.  It estimated this at around £10 billion a year.

Not only does Britain not have reserves to draw on making us vulnerable to monopoly leaders, continuing the use of these as energy is detrimental to our ever more fragile environment.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

End All Government Subsidies for Fossil Fuel Companies: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/621583

Address the Energy, Climate and Environment crisis by investing in Renewables: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/617729

Invest in new nuclear and renewable generation to replace fossil fuels: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/621050

Set a target for 70% of UK energy to be renewable by 2030
67 signatures: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/612739

attributes.action: The UK is in crisis and we, the public, are calling for a general election.
attributes.background: We want a GE so that we, the public, can make a democratic decision as to whom we think will be the most democratic, honest and work hardest to remedy the problems we currently face such as: the cost of living crisis, the NHS including all aspects, care sector, water companies etc.
attributes.additional_details:
Because over the last 12 years we have suffered austerity and now a severe cost of living crisis and this Government is not doing anywhere near enough to remedy it. We need urgent action and we need a Government that will deliver what we all need. 

The energy cap needs to be fixed, water companies need to be made to stop putting raw sewage into our rivers, the NHS and Police and Social Care are struggling to get enough staff to make people safe. The list is too long for this petition.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/619781

attributes.action: Nationalise all energy companies
attributes.background: The sale of energy (ostensibly gas and electricity) to private citizens is an essential public utility. Private companies have skimmed profits and failed to invest for decades and continue to squeeze ordinary workers on prices. They should be brought back into public ownership.
attributes.additional_details: Energy is an essential utility, true competition does not exist in this market. Rampant profiteering has destabilised the industry and is leaving millions on the brink of poverty.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/621719

attributes.action: Stop bosses and businesses taking massive bonuses while people starve !
attributes.background:
Ban bosses and share holders bonuses. Return profits to the customer and stop the cost of living crisis 
The rich are getting richer and the poor even poorer.
attributes.additional_details: Energy companies and other large organisations are coining it in from the cost of living crisis while starving families are choosing between heating or eating. Lower and minimise share holders dividends and ban bosses bonuses above a certain wage. Cap wages on directors and chairman. Return a percentage of the profits into the system to lower peoples bills on fuel and energy and food.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about remuneration for privately employed workers, including bonuses, are a matter for individual employers, not the UK Government or Parliament.

attributes.action: Control electricity and gas prices at an affordable price
attributes.background:
Limit the profits of energy companies to a morally acceptable margin and reduce the energy prices
The public is suffering at their expense, so they should accept this and contribute to helping by not ripping them off
attributes.additional_details:
The public is suffering the cost of living increases
Energy is the major contributor.
The biggest help to all is reducing energy prices.
Control the Profiteerers , seriously limiting profits to maintain low energy prices

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The fixing of the Energy Price Cap, which includes a cap on the level of profits energy suppliers can make, is a decision for Ofgem and not the UK Government or Parliament.

You can find out more about how the price cap works here: https://www.ofgem.gov.uk/publications/ofgem-confirms-changes-price-cap-methodology-and-frequency-ahead-new-rate-be-announced-later-month

attributes.action: Pay all people the same way  when getting help from the Government
attributes.background: I would like the Government not to differentiate how payments are made between employed people not entitled to any additional benefits and people receiving benefits when helping with the cost of living.
attributes.additional_details:
Everyone who receives help from the Government during these hard times should be allowed to use the help in a way that meets their needs. 
Having £400 allocated to energy companies does not help people for example who are trying to get to and from work with additional fuel prices and spiralling food costs.
Either everyone has the funding allocated to the energy providers for the additional  fuel costs or everyone has this paid directly to them.  For working people could possibly be a rebate of tax.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you're concerned about how the Government is providing cost of living support, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

It's not clear if you want the Government to pay the £650 cost of living payment to everyone, rather than just people entitled to certain benefits, or do something different.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Investigate the market price mechanism for electricity
attributes.background: Renewable electricity is relatively cheap. But the price of electricity is based on the price necessary to bring expensive gas-powered plants online.  I want the Government to take action to ensure customers are charged a realistic price for renewable energy.
attributes.additional_details:
The reason for this petition is to reduce the cost of electricity that is charged to consumers.  Electricity prices are based on the most expensive generators, not on an average cost across gas and renewables.  Electricity from offshore wind farms can cost only 5p per kWh.  Additional information can be found here:

https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/2022/jan/opinion-renewables-are-cheaper-ever-so-why-are-household-energy-bills-only-going

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you're concerned about the price of electricity, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. The wholesale energy price is set based on the cost of generating electricity, which the Government is not responsible for. 

The calculation of the energy price cap is a matter for the regulator Ofgem, which is operationally independent of the UK Government and House of Commons. You can find out more about how the price cap is calculated here: https://www.ofgem.gov.uk/information-consumers/energy-advice-households/check-if-energy-price-cap-affects-you.

attributes.action: Launch a public enquiry into the legitimacy of 2022 energy price rises
attributes.background: Given that fuel and energy has a nock on effect on all prices in the U.K. to the public. Has the Government shown negligence towards the management of the country by enabling energy firms to raise prices as high as they have, and otherwise propose to.
attributes.additional_details:
All prices are increasing from simple groceries and delivery costs to tech and industry in an effort to cover increased energy costs. The Government announced at the beginning of 2022 they had no concerns over fuel shortages as they announced the U.K. only relied on Russia for 3%
Within one or two months household energy went from around £150 per month to around £230 per month in July.
The government has not considered the damage to the economy of the general public not being able to pay this.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.  We understand you want a public inquiry into energy prices, but we're not sure what you want the inquiry to consider.  Specifically, we're not sure what you mean by 'legitimacy' of price rises and whether you want an inquiry into the Government's role in energy prices, or the role of energy companies. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. You might also like to sign this petition

Unclear - could have inquiry into causes/investigate increases.  

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/621602

attributes.action: Allow energy bills to be paid as part of salary sacrifice, saving Tax & NI
attributes.background: With prices getting incredibly high for electricity bills, can the government look to enable paying energy bills via a salary sacrifice scheme. You can currently lease an electric car, buy a bike, contribute to pension and pay for child care through a salary sacrifice scheme.
attributes.additional_details: The government rebate is welcome but due to the huge scale of the energy price rises it will help but (£66 a month, vs a monthly bill of £600+) will still fall well short of helping families through this winter. With salary sacrifice families have the chance to save huge amounts of tax and national insurance and reduce the level of energy debt they will be in by Feb / March next year. This unfortunately is a decision that cannot wait or be discussed in 6 months time.

attributes.action: Stop the Price Cap Rise
attributes.background:
The price cap rise planned in October and January should not go ahead. 
Energy companies can use their recent record profits to buy energy instead of using the pocket of U.K. customers.
attributes.additional_details: This will improve the lives of millions of people. It’s a step well within the control of the government. Energy companies still in existence in the summer of 2022 will be able to afford the wholesale energy purchases using their vast profits from the first half of 2022.

rejection.details:
The calculation of the energy price cap is a matter for the regulator Ofgem, which is operationally independent of the UK Government and House of Commons. You can find out more about how the price cap is calculated here: https://www.ofgem.gov.uk/information-consumers/energy-advice-households/check-if-energy-price-cap-affects-you.

You might like to sign this petition which calls for a related action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/611531

attributes.action: Scrap standing charges on gas and electricity bills
attributes.background:
I believe standing charges could be scrapped to reduce energy bills
And i think the government could do this quickly to help people
Struggling with energy costs

rejection.details:
Decisions about standing charges are a matter for utility providers and Ofgem, not the UK Government or Parliament. The price cap is a cap on a unit of gas and electricity, with standing charges taken into account. Find out more about the energy price cap, including how it includes standing charges, here: https://www.ofgem.gov.uk/check-if-energy-price-cap-affects-you

You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/615739

attributes.action: Nationalise power and invest in renewable energy infrastructure.
attributes.background: Stop the huge profits electricity companies are making at our expense. Electricity bills are a big driver for the inflation that is damaging lives and ruining the economy. One of the reasons given for Brexit was to take back control, if Europeans are able to apply a cap so why can’t we?
attributes.additional_details:
I would like the government to prioritise investment in renewable energy infrastructure, research grants for renewable energy and cap the price of electricity to ease the cost of living crises and bring down inflation.
The wind and sun are free! 
Energy companies should not make vast profits at our expense. The infrastructure costs and should be government funded.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

attributes.action: Nationalise Energy in the UK
attributes.background: We want the UK government to stand up and sort this cost of living crisis out for good. The only way to do this is to follow by example of other countries and nationalise energy in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: I want the UK gov to do this myself, like others right now are suffering awfully and cannot afford to heat their homes, their water or to cook their dinners. People are living in fear of turning a light on. This is not what the UK stands for.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/608056

attributes.action: STOP the price hike of Gas and Electricity
attributes.background: We want you to stop the Energy Companies from being greedy and pushing us all in the UK in to poverty with their outrageous prices!! People will end up freezing to death or starving to death over fear of using appliances in their home because of the ridiculous prices.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The energy cap is set by Ofgem, which is operationally independent of the Government and Parliament.

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/610585

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/616915

attributes.action: Immediate & Urgent Intervention of Support to Tackle the Cost of Living Crisis
attributes.background:
We, the Undersigned, call upon the Government to provide robust packages of support to all families across the UK immediately and urgently to combat the cost of living crisis, particularly with domestic fuel prices.

A reminder to you: the responsibility of Government is to protect its citizens.
attributes.additional_details:
The cost of living crisis has hit families and individuals hard and it is forecasted to get even worse. At the time of writing, the current estimates for domestic energy prices, based on typical use, will soar from £1,971/yr to over £3,500/yr in October 2022 and higher in January 2023 (Cornwall Insight).

With rising inflation and interest rates, car fuel prices, food prices and more, it is simply necessary for Government to intervene swiftly and decisively. We simply cannot let anyone suffer.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you're concerned about the cost of living, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Implement immediate actions to stop the cost of living catastrophe: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/611567

Take urgent actions to address the extreme cost of living crisis: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/612439

Temporarily suspend all taxes on all fuels and energy bills: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/610585

Remove VAT on domestic energy bills now: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/617418

Remove duty on motor fuel completely: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/613908

attributes.action: Reduce the amount of non renewable engry used in the uk by 30% by 2025
attributes.background: I want the government to spend more time, money and resources on making energy more affordable and more sustainable so that less people struggle and the uk becomes a better place.
attributes.additional_details: The government should do this to help with the cost of living which is on a rapid rise it will also help the uk become a greener country

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Address the Energy, Climate and Environment crisis by investing in Renewables: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/617729

Set a target for 70% of UK energy to be renewable by 2030: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/612739

attributes.action: Increase the maximum working hours to 30 for International Students.
attributes.background: Increase the working hours to 30 instead of 20. It would help international students to live without financial burden and will help with keeping up with the rising prices.
attributes.additional_details: With the inflation and increasing costs of living, it has become extremely difficult for international students live on 20 hour part time work. The UK's inflation is all time high and costs of rent and bills are soaring day by day. Students are financially struggling to pay their rent and bills. Inflation is at 9.1% and energy bills rose by 54%. International students are not eligible for public funds to get support from government. 30 hours of part time work will help students to earn enough money to pay rent, bills and loans.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/612081

attributes.action: Remove or Limit Expenses for Members of Parliament
attributes.background:
The country’s economy is in a poor position. We have high fuel prices, high food prices, high rental and mortgage prices and low salaries. 

This is forcing a large majority of the U.K. people into poverty. At the same time we have members of parliament on good wages who are claiming expenses.
attributes.additional_details:
The expenses that some members of parliament are getting and being approved add up to more than their salary. 

Members of parliament are expensing things such as their energy bills, second homes and much more.

Whilst the people of the U.K. are struggling with higher prices and lower wages. 

Expenses need to be capped, scrapped or managed by an independent body. At the very least capped with strict guidelines in place and limits to what can be expensed.

rejection.details:
MPs expenses are already regulated by an independent body - the Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) - which sets the rules on what expenses MPs can and can't claim. You can find out more about these rules here: https://www.theipsa.org.uk/publications/the-scheme

You could have a petition calling for the reimbursement of MPs expenses to be abolished, if that is something you'd like to see happen.

attributes.action: Abolish unfair daily charges to save every household approx £290.00 per year.
attributes.background: Abolish unfair daily charges in the energy market.
attributes.additional_details: This will save every household approx £290.00 every year.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Decisions about standing charges are a matter for utility providers and Ofgem, not the UK Government or Parliament.

The price cap is a cap on a unit of gas and electricity, with standing charges taken into account. Find out more about the energy price cap, including how it includes standing charges, here: https://www.ofgem.gov.uk/check-if-energy-price-cap-affects-you

attributes.action: Block war payments to Ukraine of 2 billion pounds.
attributes.background: Provide moral support to Ukraine only! Open a space for dialogue between Ukraine and Russia. Not to further flame the war with financial support.
attributes.additional_details: People in United Kingdom are suffering because of acute poverty, families are struggling to purchase basic needs, inflation rate is 11%. Energy cost is dramatically rising. Ukraine is suffering. It cannot defend it self with the weapons being provided. Hence a ceasefire and agreement is needed with Russia. Otherwise more lives will be lost and more blood will be shed. This is a losing battle.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/615481

attributes.action: Regulate feed in tariffs
attributes.background: With ever rising electricity tariffs energy companies should be regulated to ensure feed in tariffs for homeowners with solar panels are reasonable.
attributes.additional_details:
It would make sense to link a company’s feed in traffic to its standard tariff, eg 80%. 
So when tariffs go up so do feed in tariffs.
It’s scandalous to charge a customer 35p /kWh and yet give them 5p /kWh when they feed back into the grid.

rejection.details:
The Feed-in tariff scheme is already regulated, although it closed to new applicants in April 2019 (with some exceptions), and has been replaced by the smart export guarantee (SEG).

We have published the following petitions calling for Feed-in tariffs to be reintroduced for domestic solar panels, and for the Feed-in tariff rate for energy generated by domestic solar panels to be increased, which you might like to sign:

Reintroduce Feed-in Tariffs for domestic solar panels: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/609063

Raise the level of the Feed In Tariff (FIT) for those with home Solar Panels: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/614107

attributes.action: Stop the subsidised bars and restaurants in Westminster, and tax Lords expenses
attributes.background: With immediate effect, all subsidised food and drinks in the Palace of Westminster must end, and the £300+ daily attendance payment to the Lords must be taxed.
attributes.additional_details: As more and more people are pushed towards poverty due to soaring energy and fuel costs, which in turn are pushing up food prices, it is both unfair and immoral that those least likely to be affected by the soaring costs of living, should continue to enjoy subsidised food and drinks, and the lords should receive  a more than generous £300+ tax free daily attendance payment, funded by the very people being pushed into poverty!

rejection.details:
The House of Commons Catering service does not provide a subsidised service in the commercial sense of the word. Some venues make a profit, while in other venues the cost of providing the service exceeds the income received in sales due to the irregular hours and unpredictability of parliamentary business.

Customers of the House of Commons Catering Services include some of the 650 MPs but also around 14,500 other pass-holders, many of whom are staff on lower wages that work irregular hours. In addition, members of the public and non pass holding visitors to Parliament also have access to these services.

The House of Commons publishes details of the cost of House of Commons catering services: https://www.parliament.uk/site-information/foi/transparency-publications/hoc-transparency-publications/catering-services/transparency-reporting-catering-services/

It is up to the House of Lords what payments to make to members of the House of Lords. Whether tax has to be paid on any payments will depend on the type of payment made.

attributes.action: Stop energy companies forcing people to pay direct debit pcm for energy bills.
attributes.background: We want the goverment to stop energy companies from forcing consumers into monthly direct debit payments. Which are kept in the energy companies accounts making millions of pounds interest daily. This money is benefitting shareholders and used to run business. It drains consumers pockets.
attributes.additional_details: Energy companies are forcing direct debits to intimidate the consumers by high price increases knowing people can’t easily object. The energy companies have no direct route for consumers to complain, ie. British Gas gives no telephone number, no e mail and its chat service or call back is via South Africa cheap labour representatives who have no knowledge or solutions. Brit Gas told me they couldn’t do anything to help. The gov must stop them forcing Debit charges and explain bills clearly.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about payment arrangements for energy supplies are a matter for individual energy suppliers and Ofgem, which regulates the UK energy  sector. You can find out more about billing options suppliers have to offer here: https://www.ofgem.gov.uk/sites/default/files/docs/2019/02/licence_guide_metering_billing_and_payments_1.pdf

attributes.action: Change the way Electricity is priced, removing the lock to gas prices.
attributes.background: UK Electricity prices are exceptionally high, owing to the tie in to gas costs. This is an unsustainable. Electricity costs must be based on actual modes of generation (nuclear excepted) rather than being tied to high cost Hydrocarbon fuels.
attributes.additional_details: If I buy all my electricity as 100% renewable from a supplier who does generate this power, they have to charge me as if it were generated by Gas. Their profits increase, my costs go up. This is unsustainable Electricity generation (An exception has to be made for Nuclear energy) must be able to be based on its source, ie renewable / Hydrocarbons. Renewables can be cheaper. This will encourage  investment in renewable power generation, help in the shift to low carbon Electric Vehicles, and heating.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise.

Decisions on where energy suppliers source the energy they supply to customers, and how this affects the tariffs they offer, is a matter for individual suppliers

attributes.action: Financial support for people on chilled medication to offset energy price rises
attributes.background: With electric prices rising by double and in some cases more people who are on chilled medication need support to offset these rises as we cannot afford to have our fridges being turned off. Many people who are on these medications are on benefits and cannot afford such drastic price rises
attributes.additional_details: As someone on chilled medication I have seen my electric costs double in a short time from £20 a fortnight to £40, I am on benefits because I am disabled and this is a huge chunk of my money that I have to spend to keep my fridge on 24/7.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/610300

attributes.action: Introduce a consumer law to fine firms who don't answer the phone in 10 minutes
attributes.background: The Daily Mail is calling for a consumer protection law to force big businesses to answer calls to their customer service helplines within 10 minutes – or face fines. We want companies to provide a working phone line for customers and publish their average daily call wait times on their websites.
attributes.additional_details: We have been inundated with complaints from readers who have been left on hold for hours when calling energy suppliers, telecoms giants and major banks. The unprecedented cost-of-living squeeze is causing huge anxiety for households and we believe they should not be waiting longer than 10 minutes to speak to a human on the phone. We are calling on the Government to make this law by updating consumer protection legislation and giving regulators the power to fine.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about how to provide customer service are a matter for individual businesses, not the UK Government or Parliament.

We could accept a petition calling for changes to existing consumer protection legislation, but it would need to be clear what change you wanted to be made to this legislation.

We can only accept petitions started by individuals, not organisations, so if you start a new petition, you would need to provide a full name.

Reduce fuel duty and VAT by 40% for a period of 2 years: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599089

attributes.action: House Ukrainian Refugees in Russian Oligarch properties.
attributes.background: Seize Russian Oligarch properties in London and the UK with the aim of housing Ukrainian refugees.
attributes.additional_details: Michael Gove aired this suggestion on BBC Sunday Morning programme (13/03/22) and I believe this a perfect use for properties that  have been subject to UK sanctions against Russia regarding the Ukrainian Invasion. Squatters with the intent of making room for refugees have already occupied a London property owned by Russian energy tycoon boss, but police has since been ordered to clear the property.

Decisions about housing refugees is an operational decision for the Home Office and individual local authorities, but we have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

attributes.action: Prepare a Government strategy to ration gas and oil in solidarity with Ukraine
attributes.background:
We call on the UK Government to set out a clear strategy for rationing gas and oil. This should prepare the UK to work with European partners to coordinate strong sanctions against Russia.

The strategy should ensure rationing is socially fair and ensures essential energy access for all.
attributes.additional_details:
Russia has invaded Ukraine. This is an attack not just on Ukraine but on democracy.

It is clear Russia will be largely unaffected by most sanctions imposed so far, at least in the short term. We must cut off fossil fuel exports from Russia.

The world is watching in horror as we see civilians fleeing and their homes attacked - in Europe.

The UK is not directly dependent on Russian gas, but any sanctions will increase energy prices as we are part of a wider energy market.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure if you want the Government to start rationing oil and gas, or just publish a plan for how this would work if there was a need to do so.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.additional_details: The UK, EU and much of NATO are currently too scared to enforce full sanctions due to over-reliance on Russian energy reserves. We are are indirectly supporting Russia’s war efforts

attributes.action: Enable UK energy users to opt out of the proposed £200 'rebate' on energy bills.
attributes.background: UK users of gas and electricity should not be forced to receive the proposed £200 'discount' / 'rebate', which will then have to be paid back over time. It is effectively a loan and the Government should not force households to take a loan if they do not wish to do so. It should be optional.
attributes.additional_details: Because it is not right or fair to enforce all households to take a loan that will then affect future energy payment costs. This decision should be optional, based on whether the household wants to receive the proposed £200 rebate/discount. It should not be compulsory. If households wish to opt in to receive the rebate then that's fine, but forcing a nation to undertake a loan is beyond the remit of the Government.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/608007

attributes.action: Cut household fuel prices and take gas and electricity into public ownership.
attributes.background: Halt or reverse increases in household gas and electricity charges and renationalise both industries so they can be planned and developed in the interests of the people, society and the planet.
attributes.additional_details: Privatisation of gas and electricity has been a giant rip-off. Increases in energy costs for households, public administration and businesses in April 2022 are chiefly intended to benefit corporate shareholders, pushing millions more people into fuel poverty. Nothing short of state ownership of gas and electricity can ensure that all customers are charged a fair price that also takes into account the need to invest in renewable energy on the massive scale needed to help combat global warming.

attributes.additional_details: Because the country is facing rising costs in everything, people are now choosing whether to eat or heat their homes. Mortgage prices are increasing and this is the nail in the coffin for many people. We cannot survive like this as a nation, take a note from France's book and cap the rise at 4% not 54% and hit the energy companies hard. Stop making us working people take the hit.

attributes.action: Re-nationalize the UK energy supply industry

attributes.additional_details: Over the past five years more than 40 energy companies have failed. To say this is quite normal is ridiculous. It is clear that the current OFGEM regulated approach is not working. As a direct result millions of customers have crashed from one failed supplier to the next. Anxiety and stress caused to customers who have to pick up the bill with each failure is grossly unfair. In past decades although the industry was not competitive customers had a stable and well structured environment.

attributes.action: Government to review reform claim of 100% renewable energy sale to consumers.
attributes.background: Call on Government to review and reform the current wholesale electricity market, to increase transparency on energy companies claiming their energy is 100% renewable source when over 50% of the energy being produced is clearly hedged against fossil fuels.
attributes.additional_details:
Consumer spending needs to be a major consideration in the shift to a net zero carbon future. Over 70% of people believe that what they do, how they live and what they buy can have an affect on carbon reduction.

Subscribing to a 100% renewable energy tarriff the consumer expects that energy from a 100% renewable source. Thus increasing the pot of funding in renewable energy infrastructure such as wind, solar, geothermal, green hydrogen and reducing the energy from fossil fuels long term.

rejection.details:
In September 2021, the Government announced that the Competition and Markets Authority will carry out a full review of misleading green claims, both on and offline, at the start of 2022. 

During that period, the Government published a "Green Claims Code" to help businesses comply with the law in any claims about their environmental impact. 

You can find out about the CMA review and the Green Claims Code here: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/greenwashing-cma-puts-businesses-on-notice

attributes.action: Enforce Energy Companies to establish a lower electric rate for heat pumps
attributes.background: Ask electric companies to create a lower electric rate for heat pumps
attributes.additional_details: The uk has committed to be zero emissions by 2050 and is changing the way we heat our homes and buildings! The Uk wants to install 600,000 heat pumps per year and we need a dedicated electric rate for heat pumps

rejection.details:
The rates charged by utility companies for supplying electricity to UK customers, within the limits set by the energy price cap, are a matter for those utility companies, not the UK Government or Parliament. This means the Government is not directly responsible for the action this petition calls for.

You could have a petition calling on the Government to create a separate price cap for renewable energy, if that is something you'd like to see happen.

'Review and reform proposed Government grants for Air Source Heat Pumps': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/594372

attributes.action: Ban automotive OEMs using the phrase 'self-charging' to mislead the UK consumer.
attributes.background:
OEMs are deliberately deceiving the consumer into thinking some hybrids 'self-charge'. This isn't true, since the electricity comes from consuming Petrol or Diesel. In a time of environmental crisis, allowing OEMs to mislead the consumer is deplorable. 

Please make this phrase illegal.
attributes.additional_details:
It is misleading to give the impression that the power to the hybrid battery has some magical self perpetuating energy source, since the electricity produced by the car has consumption of Petrol/Diesel as a necessary condition: Regenerative energy will in all practical respects have consumption of Petrol or Diesel as a necessary condition but never stated.

Toyota’s ‘self-charging hybrid’ ad has been banned in Norway and deemed false advertising by the consumer authority, and with good reason.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about whether advertising for a product is misleading are a matter for the Advertising Standards Authority (ASA), not the Government or Parliament. As a result it is not possible for the Government or Parliament to take the action you have requested.

If you would like to complain about an advert you can do so here: https://www.asa.org.uk/make-a-complaint.html
